Description: Adds an Azure Storage Account config to the configuration store
Params: The logical name of the Azure Storage Account you are about to registered in the configuration store
The account id for the Azure Storage Account you want to register in the configuration store
The access token for the Azure Storage Account you want to register in the configuration store
The SAS key that you have created for the storage account or blob container
The name of the blob container inside the Azure Storage Account you want to register in the configuration store
Instruct the cmdlet to only temporarily add the azure storage account configuration in the configuration store
Switch to instruct the cmdlet to overwrite already registered Azure Storage Account entry
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Save an Azure Storage Account config
Name: Add-FSCPSAzureStorageConfig
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Add-FSCPSAzureStorageConfig -Name "UAT-Exports" -AccountId "1234" -AccessToken "dafdfasdfasdf" -Container "testblob"
This will add an entry into the list of Azure Storage Accounts that is stored with the name "UAT-Exports" with AccountId "1234", AccessToken "dafdfasdfasdf" and blob container "testblob".
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Add-FSCPSAzureStorageConfig -Name UAT-Exports -SAS "sv2018-03-28&siunlisted&src&sigAUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" -AccountId "1234" -Container "testblob"
This will add an entry into the list of Azure Storage Accounts that is stored with the name "UAT-Exports" with AccountId "1234", SAS 
"sv=2018-03-28&si=unlisted&sr=c&sig=AUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" and blob container "testblob".
The SAS key enables you to provide explicit access to a given blob container inside an Azure Storage Account.
The SAS key can easily be revoked and that way you have control over the access to the container and its content.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
PS C:\>Add-FSCPSAzureStorageConfig -Name UAT-Exports -SAS "sv2018-03-28&siunlisted&src&sigAUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" -AccountId "1234" -Container "testblob" -Temporary
This will add an entry into the list of Azure Storage Accounts that is stored with the name "UAT-Exports" with AccountId "1234", SAS 
"sv=2018-03-28&si=unlisted&sr=c&sig=AUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" and blob container "testblob".
The SAS key enables you to provide explicit access to a given blob container inside an Azure Storage Account.
The SAS key can easily be revoked and that way you have control over the access to the container and its content.
The configuration will only last for the rest of this PowerShell console session.

Description:
Restore the default exception behavior of the module to not support throwing exceptions

Useful when the default behavior was changed with Enable-FSCPSException and the default behavior should be restored
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Disables throwing of exceptions
Name: Disable-FSCPSException
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Disable-FSCPSException
This will restore the default behavior of the module to not support throwing exceptions.

Description:
Change the default exception behavior of the module to support throwing exceptions

Useful when the module is used in an automated fashion, like inside Azure DevOps pipelines and large PowerShell scripts
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Enable exceptions to be thrown
Name: Enable-FSCPSException
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Enable-FSCPSException
This will for the rest of the current PowerShell session make sure that exceptions will be thrown.

Description: Finds fscps.tools commands searching through the inline help text, building a consolidated json index and querying it because Get-Help is too slow
Params: Searches help for all commands in fscps.tools for the specified pattern and displays all results
Finds all commands tagged with this auto-populated tag
Finds all commands tagged with this author
Finds all commands tagged with this auto-populated minimum version
Finds all commands tagged with this auto-populated maximum version

By default, when something goes wrong we try to catch it, interpret it and give you a friendly warning message.
This avoids overwhelming you with "sea of red" exceptions, but is inconvenient because it basically disables advanced scripting.
Using this switch turns this "nice by default" feature off and enables you to catch exceptions with your own try/catch.
Displays what would happen if the command is run
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Finds fscps.tools commands searching through the inline help text
Name: Find-FSCPSCommand
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Find-FSCPSCommand "snapshot"
For lazy typers: finds all commands searching the entire help for "snapshot"
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Find-FSCPSCommand -Pattern "snapshot"
For rigorous typers: finds all commands searching the entire help for "snapshot"
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
PS C:\>Find-FSCPSCommand -Tag copy
Finds all commands tagged with "copy"
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
PS C:\>Find-FSCPSCommand -Tag copy,user
Finds all commands tagged with BOTH "copy" and "user"
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
PS C:\>Find-FSCPSCommand -Author Mötz
Finds every command whose author contains "Mötz"
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
PS C:\>Find-FSCPSCommand -Author Mötz -Tag copy
Finds every command whose author contains "Mötz" and it tagged as "copy"
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 7 --------------------------
PS C:\>Find-FSCPSCommand -Rebuild
Finds all commands and rebuilding the index (good for developers)

Description: Get active Azure Storage Account configuration object from the configuration store
Params: Instruct the cmdlet to return a PsCustomObject object
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Get active Azure Storage Account configuration
Name: Get-FSCPSActiveAzureStorageConfig
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSActiveAzureStorageConfig
This will get the active Azure Storage configuration.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSActiveAzureStorageConfig -OutputAsPsCustomObject:$true
This will get the active Azure Storage configuration.
The object will be output as a PsCustomObject, for you to utilize across your scripts.

Description:
The `Get-FSCPSADOAgent` function retrieves agents from a specified agent pool in Azure DevOps.
It requires the organization, agent pool ID, and a valid authentication token. The function constructs
the appropriate URL, makes the REST API call, and returns detailed information about the agents,
including their capabilities and statuses. It also handles errors and interruptions gracefully.
Params: The ID of the agent pool from which to retrieve agents.
The name of the Azure DevOps organization. If not in the form of a URL, it will be prefixed with "https://dev.azure.com/".
The version of the Azure DevOps REST API to use. Default is "7.0".
The authentication token for accessing Azure DevOps.
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Retrieves agents from a specified agent pool in Azure DevOps.
Name: Get-FSCPSADOAgent
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSADOAgent -AgentPoolId 1 -Organization "my-org" -Token "Bearer my-token"
This example retrieves agents from the agent pool with ID 1 in the specified organization.

Description:
The `Get-FSCPSADOTestCase` function retrieves detailed information about a specified test case from Azure DevOps.
It requires the organization, project, test case ID, and a valid authentication token. The function constructs
the appropriate URL, makes the REST API call, and returns the fields of the test case. It also handles errors
and interruptions gracefully.
Params: The ID of the test case to retrieve information for.
The name of the Azure DevOps project.
The name of the Azure DevOps organization. If not in the form of a URL, it will be prefixed with "https://dev.azure.com/".
The version of the Azure DevOps REST API to use. Default is "7.1".
The authentication token for accessing Azure DevOps.
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Retrieves information about a specific test case from Azure DevOps.
Name: Get-FSCPSADOTestCase
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSADOTestCase -TestCaseId 1234 -Project "my-project" -Organization "my-org" -Token "Bearer my-token"
This example retrieves detailed information about the test case with ID 1234 in the specified organization and project.

Description:
The `Get-FSCPSADOTestCasesBySuite` function retrieves test cases from a specified test suite within a specified test plan
in an Azure DevOps project. The function requires the organization, project, test suite ID, test plan ID, and a valid
authentication token. It uses the Azure DevOps REST API to perform the operation and handles errors gracefully.
Params: The ID of the test suite from which to retrieve test cases.
The ID of the test plan containing the test suite.
The name of the Azure DevOps organization.
The name of the Azure DevOps project.
The version of the Azure DevOps REST API to use. Default is "6.0".
The authentication token for accessing Azure DevOps.
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Retrieves test cases from a specified test suite in Azure DevOps.
Name: Get-FSCPSADOTestCasesBySuite
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSADOTestCasesBySuite -TestSuiteId 1001 -TestPlanId 2001 -Organization "my-org" -Project "my-project" -Token "Bearer my-token"
This example retrieves the test cases from the test suite with ID 1001 within the test plan with ID 2001 in the specified organization and project.

Description:
The `Get-FSCPSADOTestSuiteByTestCase` function retrieves the test suite associated with a specified test case ID from Azure DevOps.
It requires the organization, project, test case ID, and a valid authentication token. The function returns the test suite information
and handles any errors that may occur during the request.
Params: The ID of the test case for which to retrieve the associated test suite.
The name of the Azure DevOps project.
The name of the Azure DevOps organization.
The version of the Azure DevOps REST API to use. Default is "5.0".
The authentication token for accessing Azure DevOps.
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Retrieves the test suite associated with a specific test case from Azure DevOps.
Name: Get-FSCPSADOTestSuiteByTestCase
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSADOTestSuiteByTestCase -TestCaseId 1460 -Project "my-project" -Organization "my-org" -Token "Bearer my-token"
This example retrieves the test suite associated with the test case ID 1460 in the specified organization and project.

Description:
The `Get-FSCPSADOTestSuitesByTestPlan` function retrieves test suites from a specified Azure DevOps test plan.
It requires the organization, project, test plan ID, and a valid authentication token. The function handles
pagination through the use of a continuation token and returns the test suites.
Params: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.
The name of the Azure DevOps project.
The ID of the test plan from which to retrieve test suites.
The authentication token for accessing Azure DevOps.
The version of the Azure DevOps REST API to use. Default is "7.1".
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Retrieves test suites from an Azure DevOps test plan.
Name: Get-FSCPSADOTestSuitesByTestPlan
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSADOTestSuitesByTestPlan -Organization "my-org" -Project "my-project" -TestPlanId 123 -Token "Bearer my-token"
This example retrieves test suites from the test plan with ID 123 in the specified organization and project.

Description: Get all Azure Storage Account configuration objects from the configuration store
Params:
The name of the Azure Storage Account you are looking for
Default value is "*" to display all Azure Storage Account configs
Instruct the cmdlet to return a hastable object
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Get Azure Storage Account configs
Name: Get-FSCPSAzureStorageConfig
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSAzureStorageConfig
This will show all Azure Storage Account configs
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSAzureStorageConfig -OutputAsHashtable
This will show all Azure Storage Account configs.
Every object will be output as a hashtable, for you to utilize as parameters for other cmdlets.

Description: Get all files from an Azure Storage Account
Params: Storage Account Name / Storage Account Id where you want to look for files
The token that has the needed permissions for the search action
The SAS key that you have created for the storage account or blob container
Name of the blob container inside the storage account where you want to look for files

Name of the file you are looking for
Accepts wildcards for searching. E.g. -Name "Application*Adaptor"
Default value is "*" which will search for all files
The destination folder of the Azure file to download. If empty just show the file information
Instruct the cmdlet to only fetch the latest file from the Azure Storage Account
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Get a file from Azure
Name: Get-FSCPSAzureStorageFile
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSAzureStorageFile -AccountId "miscfiles" -AccessToken "xx508xx63817x752xx74004x30705xx92x58349x5x78f5xx34xxxxx51" -Container "backupfiles"
This will get the information of all files in the blob container "backupfiles".
It will use the AccessToken "xx508xx63817x752xx74004x30705xx92x58349x5x78f5xx34xxxxx51" to gain access.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSAzureStorageFile -AccountId "miscfiles" -AccessToken "xx508xx63817x752xx74004x30705xx92x58349x5x78f5xx34xxxxx51" -Container "backupfiles" -Latest
This will get the information of the latest (newest) file from the blob container "backupfiles".
It will use the AccessToken "xx508xx63817x752xx74004x30705xx92x58349x5x78f5xx34xxxxx51" to gain access to the container.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSAzureStorageFile -AccountId "miscfiles" -AccessToken "xx508xx63817x752xx74004x30705xx92x58349x5x78f5xx34xxxxx51" -Container "backupfiles" -Name "*UAT*"
This will get the information of all files in the blob container "backupfiles" that fits the "*UAT*" search value.
It will use the AccessToken "xx508xx63817x752xx74004x30705xx92x58349x5x78f5xx34xxxxx51" to gain access to the container.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSAzureStorageFile -AccountId "miscfiles" -SAS "sv2018-03-28&siunlisted&src&sigAUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" -Container "backupfiles" -Latest
This will get the information of the latest (newest) file from the blob container "backupfiles".
It will use the SAS key "sv2018-03-28&siunlisted&src&sigAUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" to gain access to the container.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSAzureStorageFile -AccountId "miscfiles" -SAS "sv2018-03-28&siunlisted&src&sigAUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" -Container "backupfiles" -Name "*UAT*" -DestinationPath "C:\Temp"
This will get the information of all files in the blob container "backupfiles" that fits the "*UAT*" search value.
It will also download all the files to the "C:\Temp" folder.
It will use the SAS key "sv2018-03-28&siunlisted&src&sigAUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" to gain access to the container.

Description: This gets the D365FSC model version from the descriptor file by automatically finding the descriptor in the model path
Params: Path to the model folder (automatically searches for Descriptor\*.xml inside)
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: This gets the D365FSC model version
Name: Get-FSCPSModelVersion
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSModelVersion -ModelPath "c:\temp\metadata\TestModel"
This will get the version information of the TestModel by automatically finding the descriptor file
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSModelVersion -ModelPath "c:\temp\PackagesLocalDirectory\MyCustomModel"
This will get the version information of MyCustomModel including layer name

Description:
Get the D365FSC NuGet package from storage account

Full list of NuGet: https://lcs.dynamics.com/V2/SharedAssetLibrary and select NuGet packages
Params: The version of the NuGet package to download
The short FNO version (e.g. "10.0.45"). The actual NuGet version will be resolved using the version info data and the KnownType parameter
The version strategy to use when resolving KnownVersion. Valid values are GA and Latest
The type of the NuGet package to download
The destination folder of the NuGet package to download
Instruct the cmdlet to override the package if exists
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Get the D365FSC NuGet package
Name: Get-FSCPSNuget
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSNuget -Version "10.0.1777.99" -Type PlatformCompilerPackage
This will download the NuGet package with version "10.0.1777.99" and type "PlatformCompilerPackage" to the current folder
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSNuget -Version "10.0.1777.99" -Type PlatformCompilerPackage -Path "c:\temp"
This will download the NuGet package with version "10.0.1777.99" and type "PlatformCompilerPackage" to the c:\temp folder
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSNuget -Version "10.0.1777.99" -Type PlatformCompilerPackage -Path "c:\temp" -Force
This will download the NuGet package with version "10.0.1777.99" and type "PlatformCompilerPackage" to the c:\temp folder and override if the package with the same name exists.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSNuget -KnownVersion "10.0.45" -KnownType GA -Type PlatformCompilerPackage -Path "c:\temp"
This will resolve the GA platform version for FNO 10.0.45 and download the PlatformCompilerPackage NuGet to c:\temp
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSNuget -KnownVersion "10.0.45" -KnownType Latest -Type ApplicationDevALM -Path "c:\temp"
This will resolve the Latest application version for FNO 10.0.45 and download the ApplicationDevALM NuGet to c:\temp
Syntax:
Get-FSCPSNuget -Version <String> -Type {ApplicationSuiteDevALM | ApplicationDevALM | PlatformDevALM | PlatformCompilerPackage} [-Path <String>] [-Force] [<CommonParameters>]
Get-FSCPSNuget -KnownVersion <String> -KnownType {GA | Latest} -Type {ApplicationSuiteDevALM | ApplicationDevALM | PlatformDevALM | PlatformCompilerPackage} [-Path <String>] [-Force] [<CommonParameters>]

Description:
Get the FSCPS configuration details from the configuration store

All settings retrieved from this cmdlets is to be considered the default parameter values across the different cmdlets
Params: String contains path to the settings.json
Instruct the cmdlet to return a hashtable object
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Get the FSCPS configuration details
Name: Get-FSCPSSettings
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSSettings
This will output the current FSCPS configuration.
The object returned will be a PSCustomObject.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSSettings -OutputAsHashtable
This will output the current FSCPS configuration.
The object returned will be a Hashtable.

Description: The `Get-FSCPSSystemUpdatePackage` function downloads a system update package for Dynamics 365 Finance and Supply Chain (D365FSC) based on the specified update type and version. The package is downloaded from Azure Storage using the specified storage account configuration and saved to the specified output path.
Params: Specifies the type of update package to download. Valid values are "SystemUpdate" and "Preview".
Specifies the version of the D365FSC package to download.
Specifies the path where the downloaded package will be saved.
Specifies the storage account configuration to use. Default is "PackageStorage".
Forces the operation to proceed without prompting for confirmation.
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Downloads a system update package for D365FSC.
Name: Get-FSCPSSystemUpdatePackage
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSSystemUpdatePackage -UpdateType SystemUpdate -D365FSCVersion "10.0.40" -OutputPath "C:\Packages\"
Downloads the system update package for version 10.0.40 and saves it to "C:\Packages\".

Description: Get the list of D365FSC components versions (NuGets, Packages, Frameworks etc.)
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Get the list of D365FSC components versions
Name: Get-FSCPSVersionInfo
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Get-FSCPSVersionInfo -Version "10.0.39"
This will show the list of file versions for the FSCPS module of the 10.0.39 D365FSC.

Description: Download latest Nuget CLI
Params:
Url/Uri to where the latest nuget download is located
The default value is "https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/latest/nuget.exe"
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Installation of Nuget CLI
Name: Install-FSCPSNugetCLI
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Install-FSCPSNugetCLI -Path "C:\temp\fscps.tools\nuget" -Url "https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/latest/nuget.exe"
This will download the latest version of nuget.

Description: Function to sign the files with KeyVault
Params: A fully qualified URL of the key vault with the certificate that will be used for signing. An example value might be https://my-vault.vault.azure.net.
This is the tenant id used to authenticate to Azure, which will be used to generate an access token.
The name of the certificate used to perform the signing operation.
This is the client ID used to authenticate to Azure, which will be used to generate an access token.
This is the client secret used to authenticate to Azure, which will be used to generate an access token.
A URL to an RFC3161 compliant timestamping service.
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Function to sign the files with KeyVault
Name: Invoke-FSCPSAzureSignToolSignFile
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSAzureSignToolSignFile -Uri "https://my-vault.vault.azure.net" `
-TenantId "01234567-abcd-ef012-0000-0123456789ab" `
    -CertificateName "my-key-name" `
    -ClientId "01234567-abcd-ef012-0000-0123456789ab" `
    -ClientSecret "secret" `
    -FILE "$filePath"
This will sign the target file with the KeyVault certificate

Description: Delete any file to an Azure Storage Account
Params: Storage Account Name / Storage Account Id where you want to store the file
The token that has the needed permissions for the delete action
The SAS key that you have created for the storage account or blob container
Name of the blob container inside the storage account you want to store the file
Path to the file you want to delete
Instruct the cmdlet to overwrite the file in the container if it already exists

This parameters disables user-friendly warnings and enables the throwing of exceptions
This is less user friendly, but allows catching exceptions in calling scripts
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Delete a file to Azure
Name: Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageDelete
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>$AzureParams = Get-FSCActiveAzureStorageConfig
PS C:\> New-D365Bacpac | Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageDelete @AzureParams
This will get the current Azure Storage Account configuration details and use them as parameters to delete the file from Azure Storage Account.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageDelete -AccountId "miscfiles" -SAS "sv2018-03-28&siunlisted&src&sigAUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" -Container "backupfiles" -FileName "UAT_20180701.bacpac"
This will delete the "UAT_20180701.bacpac" from the "backupfiles" container, inside the "miscfiles" Azure Storage Account.
A SAS key is used to gain access to the container and deleteng the file.

Description: Download any file to an Azure Storage Account
Params: Storage Account Name / Storage Account Id where you want to fetch the file from
The token that has the needed permissions for the download action
The SAS key that you have created for the storage account or blob container
Name of the blob container inside the storage account you where the file is
Name of the file that you want to download

Path to the folder / location you want to save the file
The default path is "c:\temp\fscps.tools"
Instruct the cmdlet to download the latest file from Azure regardless of name
Instruct the cmdlet to overwrite the local file if it already exists

This parameters disables user-friendly warnings and enables the throwing of exceptions
This is less user friendly, but allows catching exceptions in calling scripts
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Download a file to Azure
Name: Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageDownload
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageDownload -AccountId "miscfiles" -AccessToken "xx508xx63817x752xx74004x30705xx92x58349x5x78f5xx34xxxxx51" -Container "backupfiles" -FileName "OriginalUAT.bacpac" -Path 
"c:\temp"
Will download the "OriginalUAT.bacpac" file from the storage account and save it to "c:\temp\OriginalUAT.bacpac"
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageDownload -AccountId "miscfiles" -AccessToken "xx508xx63817x752xx74004x30705xx92x58349x5x78f5xx34xxxxx51" -Container "backupfiles" -Path "c:\temp" -Latest
Will download the file with the latest modified datetime from the storage account and save it to "c:\temp\".
The complete path to the file will returned as output from the cmdlet.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
PS C:\>$AzureParams = Get-FSCPSActiveAzureStorageConfig
PS C:\> Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageDownload @AzureParams -Path "c:\temp" -Latest
This will get the current Azure Storage Account configuration details
and use them as parameters to download the latest file from an Azure Storage Account
Will download the file with the latest modified datetime from the storage account and save it to "c:\temp\".
The complete path to the file will returned as output from the cmdlet.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageDownload -Latest
This will use the default parameter values that are based on the configuration stored inside "Get-FSCPSActiveAzureStorageConfig".
Will download the file with the latest modified datetime from the storage account and save it to "c:\temp\fscps.tools".
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageDownload -AccountId "miscfiles" -SAS "sv2018-03-28&siunlisted&src&sigAUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" -Container "backupfiles" -Path "c:\temp" -Latest
Will download the file with the latest modified datetime from the storage account and save it to "c:\temp\".
A SAS key is used to gain access to the container and downloading the file from it.
The complete path to the file will returned as output from the cmdlet.

Description: Upload any file to an Azure Storage Account
Params: Storage Account Name / Storage Account Id where you want to store the file
The token that has the needed permissions for the upload action
The SAS key that you have created for the storage account or blob container
Name of the blob container inside the storage account you want to store the file
Path to the file you want to upload

Media type of the file that is going to be uploaded
The value will be used for the blob property "Content Type".
If the parameter is left empty, the commandlet will try to automatically determined the value based on the file's extension.
The content type "application/octet-stream" will be used as fallback if no value can be determined.
Valid media type values can be found here: https://github.com/jshttp/mime-db
Instruct the cmdlet to overwrite the file in the container if it already exists
Switch to tell the cmdlet if you want the local file to be deleted after the upload completes

This parameters disables user-friendly warnings and enables the throwing of exceptions
This is less user friendly, but allows catching exceptions in calling scripts
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Upload a file to Azure
Name: Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageUpload
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageUpload -AccountId "miscfiles" -AccessToken "xx508xx63817x752xx74004x30705xx92x58349x5x78f5xx34xxxxx51" -Container "backupfiles" -Filepath 
"c:\temp\bacpac\UAT_20180701.bacpac"  -DeleteOnUpload
This will upload the "c:\temp\bacpac\UAT_20180701.bacpac" up to the "backupfiles" container, inside the "miscfiles" Azure Storage Account that is access with the 
"xx508xx63817x752xx74004x30705xx92x58349x5x78f5xx34xxxxx51" token.
After upload the local file will be deleted.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>$AzureParams = Get-D365ActiveAzureStorageConfig
PS C:\> New-D365Bacpac | Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageUpload @AzureParams
This will get the current Azure Storage Account configuration details and use them as parameters to upload the file to an Azure Storage Account.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
PS C:\>New-D365Bacpac | Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageUpload
This will generate a new bacpac file using the "New-D365Bacpac" cmdlet.
The file will be uploaded to an Azure Storage Account using the "Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageUpload" cmdlet.
This will use the default parameter values that are based on the configuration stored inside "Get-D365ActiveAzureStorageConfig" for the "Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageUpload" cmdlet.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSAzureStorageUpload -AccountId "miscfiles" -SAS "sv2018-03-28&siunlisted&src&sigAUOpdsfpoWE976ASDhfjkasdf(5678sdfhk" -Container "backupfiles" -Filepath 
"c:\temp\bacpac\UAT_20180701.bacpac"
This will upload the "c:\temp\bacpac\UAT_20180701.bacpac" up to the "backupfiles" container, inside the "miscfiles" Azure Storage Account.
A SAS key is used to gain access to the container and uploading the file to it.

Description:
Installs software from Chocolatey

Full list of software: https://community.chocolatey.org/packages
Params:
The command of the choco to execute
Support a list of softwares that you want to have installed on the system
Force command. Reinstall latest version if command is install or upgrade to latest version
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Install software from Choco
Name: Invoke-FSCPSChoco
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSChoco install gh -y --allow-unofficial -Silent
This will install GH tools on the system without console output

Description: Invoke the D365FSC models compilation
Params: The version of the D365FSC used to build
The folder contains a metadata files with binaries
The type of the FSCPS project to build
Instruct the cmdlet to return a hashtable object
Cleanup destination build folder befor build
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Invoke the D365FSC models compilation
Name: Invoke-FSCPSCompile
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSCompile -Version "10.0.39" -Type FSCM
Example output:
METADATA_DIRECTORY  : D:\a\8\s\Metadata
FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORY : C:\temp\buildbuild\packages\Microsoft.Dynamics.AX.Platform.CompilerPackage.7.0.7120.99
BUILD_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY    : C:\temp\buildbuild\bin
NUGETS_FOLDER    : C:\temp\buildbuild\packages
BUILD_LOG_FILE_PATH     : C:\Users\VssAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\Build.sln.msbuild.log
PACKAGE_NAME         : MAIN TEST-DeployablePackage-10.0.39-78
PACKAGE_PATH         : C:\temp\buildbuild\artifacts\MAIN TEST-DeployablePackage-10.0.39-78.zip
ARTIFACTS_PATH       : C:\temp\buildbuild\artifacts
ARTIFACTS_LIST       : ["C:\temp\buildbuild\artifacts\MAIN TEST-DeployablePackage-10.0.39-78.zip"]
This will build D365FSC package with version "10.0.39" to the Temp folder
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSCompile -Version "10.0.39" -Path "c:\Temp"
Example output:
METADATA_DIRECTORY  : D:\a\8\s\Metadata
FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORY : C:\temp\buildbuild\packages\Microsoft.Dynamics.AX.Platform.CompilerPackage.7.0.7120.99
BUILD_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY    : C:\temp\buildbuild\bin
NUGETS_FOLDER    : C:\temp\buildbuild\packages
BUILD_LOG_FILE_PATH     : C:\Users\VssAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\Build.sln.msbuild.log
PACKAGE_NAME         : MAIN TEST-DeployablePackage-10.0.39-78
PACKAGE_PATH         : C:\temp\buildbuild\artifacts\MAIN TEST-DeployablePackage-10.0.39-78.zip
ARTIFACTS_PATH       : C:\temp\buildbuild\artifacts
ARTIFACTS_LIST       : ["C:\temp\buildbuild\artifacts\MAIN TEST-DeployablePackage-10.0.39-78.zip"]
This will build D365FSC package with version "10.0.39" to the Temp folder

Description: Function to sign the files with digicert
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Function to sign the files with digicert
Name: Invoke-FSCPSDigiCertSignFile
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSDigiCertSignFile -SM_API_KEY "$codeSignDigiCertAPISecretName" `
-SM_CLIENT_CERT_FILE_URL "$codeSignDigiCertUrlSecretName" `
    -SM_CLIENT_CERT_PASSWORD $(ConvertTo-SecureString $codeSignDigiCertPasswordSecretName -AsPlainText -Force) `
    -SM_CODE_SIGNING_CERT_SHA1_HASH "$codeSignDigiCertHashSecretName" `
    -FILE "$filePath"
This will sign the target file with the DigiCert certificate

Description: The `Invoke-FSCPSInstallModule` function takes an array of module names, installs them if they are not already installed, and then imports them. It also handles the uninstallation of the "AzureRm" module if "Az" is specified. Real-time monitoring is temporarily disabled during the installation process to speed it up.
Params: An array of module names to be installed and imported.
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Installs and imports specified PowerShell modules, with special handling for the "Az" module.
Name: Invoke-FSCPSInstallModule
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Invoke-FSCPSInstallModule -Modules @("Az", "Pester")
This example installs and imports the "Az" and "Pester" modules in the current user scope.

Description: Register all Azure Storage Configurations
Params:
Parameter used to instruct where to store the configuration objects
The default value is "User" and this will store all configuration for the active user
Valid options are:
"User"
"System"
"System" will store the configuration as default for all users, so they can access the configuration objects
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Register Azure Storage Configurations
Name: Register-FSCPSAzureStorageConfig
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Register-FSCPSAzureStorageConfig -ConfigStorageLocation "System"
This will store all Azure Storage Configurations as defaults for all users on the machine.

Description: Updates the current active Azure Storage Account configuration with a new one
Params: The name the Azure Storage Account configuration you want to load into the active Azure Storage Account configuration

Parameter used to instruct where to store the configuration objects
The default value is "User" and this will store all configuration for the active user
Valid options are:
"User"
"System"
"System" will store the configuration so all users can access the configuration objects
Instruct the cmdlet to only temporarily override the persisted settings in the configuration storage
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Set the active Azure Storage Account configuration
Name: Set-FSCPSActiveAzureStorageConfig
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Set-FSCPSActiveAzureStorageConfig -Name "UAT-Exports"
This will import the "UAT-Exports" set from the Azure Storage Account configurations.
It will update the active Azure Storage Account configuration.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
PS C:\>Set-FSCPSActiveAzureStorageConfig -Name "UAT-Exports" -ConfigStorageLocation "System"
This will import the "UAT-Exports" set from the Azure Storage Account configurations.
It will update the active Azure Storage Account configuration.
The data will be stored in the system wide configuration storage, which makes it accessible from all users.
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
PS C:\>Set-FSCPSActiveAzureStorageConfig -Name "UAT-Exports" -Temporary
This will import the "UAT-Exports" set from the Azure Storage Account configurations.
It will update the active Azure Storage Account configuration.
The update will only last for the rest of this PowerShell console session.

Description:
Set the FSCPS configuration details from the configuration store

All settings retrieved from this cmdlets is to be considered the default parameter values across the different cmdlets
Params: Set path to the settings.json file
String contains JSON with custom settings
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Set the FSCPS configuration details
Name: Set-FSCPSSettings
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Set-FSCPSSettings -SettingsFilePath "c:\temp\settings.json"
This will output the current FSCPS configuration.
The object returned will be a Hashtable.

Description: Download latest Nuget CLI
Params: Path to the local Metadata folder
Url/Uri to zip file contains code/package/axmodel
The name of the file should be downloaded by the url. Use if the url doesnt contain the filename.
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: Installation of Nuget CLI
Name: Update-FSCPSISVSource
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Update-FSCPSISVSource MetadataPath "C:\temp\PackagesLocalDirectory" -Url "https://ciellosarchive.blob.core.windows.net/test/Main-Extension-10.0.39_20240516.263.zip?sv=2023-01-03&st=2024-05-21T1
4%3A26%3A41Z&se=2034-05-22T14%3A26%3A00Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=W%2FbS1bQrr59i%2FBSHWsftkfNsE1HvFXTrICwZSFiUItg%3D""
This will update the local metadata with the source from the downloaded zip archive.

Description: This updates the D365FSC model version
Params: Path to the xpp metadata folder
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: This updates the D365FSC model version
Name: Update-FSCPSModelVersion
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Update-FSCPSModelVersion -xppSourcePath "c:\temp\metadata" -xppLayer "ISV" -versionNumber "5.4.8.4" -xppDescriptorSearch $("TestModel"+"\Descriptor\*.xml")
this will change the version of the TestModel to 5.4.8.4

Description: This uploads the D365FSC nugets from the LCS to the active NuGet storage account
Params: The ClientId what has access to the LCS
The minimum version of the FSC to update the NuGet`s
Author: Oleksandr Nikolaiev (@onikolaiev)
Synopsis: This uploads the D365FSC nugets from the LCS to the active storage account
Name: Update-FSCPSNugetsFromLCS
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Update-FSCPSNugetsFromLCS -LCSUserName "admin@contoso.com" -LCSUserPassword "superSecureString" -LCSProjectId "123456" -LCSClientId "123ebf68-a86d-4392-ae38-57b2172ee789" -FSCMinimumVersion 
"10.0.38"
this will uploads the D365FSC nugets from the LCS to the active storage account

Description:
This function checks the specified web drivers path. If the path doesn't exist, it uses a default path. It defines registry paths and URLs, retrieves the local web driver versions, and checks if an update is needed based on version comparison.

The function updates the web drivers for both Microsoft Edge and Google Chrome browsers by downloading the latest versions from their respective official websites and extracting the files to the specified path.
Params: The path where the web drivers are located. Default is "C:\Program Files (x86)\Regression Suite Automation Tool\Common\External\Selenium".
Synopsis: Update the web drivers for Microsoft Edge and Google Chrome browsers.
Name: Update-FSCPSRSATWebDriver
Examples:
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
PS C:\>Update-FSCPSRSATWebDriver -webDriversPath "C:\CustomPath\WebDrivers"
This example will update the webdrivers for the RSAT tool located at the specified path.
